title: Pokemon Thieves Make Off With $100,000 In Rare Cards
description: Pokemon cards are as hot as they've ever been, and unfortunately for a local card shop in California, it means their merchandise was the target of a recent heist. On December 2, thieves targeted LA Sports Cards in Burbank and made off with $100,000 or more in Pokemon cards and other collectibles. The trio of thieves were captured on camera in KTLA 5's video report below. Store owner Kiet Nguyen noted that the thieves seemed to know just where to go to get the most valuable Pokemon cards in the store. "Liquid assets" of unopened Pokemon boxes were also taken, and will be easy to sell because of how common they are. Additionally, the thieves stole rare sports cards that featured Mickey Mantle and Ronaldo among others. The thieves were in and out of the store in around three minutes, and the report notes that this trio may have hit other card shops in Southern California. One of the thieves exposed part of his face during an earlier heist, and that could help police eventually track him and his partners down. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: A Full Star Wars: KOTOR 2 Remake Was In Development - Report
description: For a minute there, a full-on remake of Obsidian Entertainment's Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic 2 was apparently in development. However, the project appears to have been put on hold, according to a new report. According to Game File's reporting, new legal documents revealed that Aspyr and Lucasfilm Games were working on a full remake of KOTOR 2. Codenamed "Juliet" in the files, the project was a modern remake of the iconic 2004 RPG and was in development alongside the KOTOR remake, which developer Saber Interactive said is still coming. However, per Game File and unlike the KOTOR remake, development on the KOTOR II remake has ceased as recently as March 2025. Lucasfilm Games VP Douglas Reilly explained in depositions about the drama surrounding KOTOR II that, had the remake come to fruition, it would've contained the cut DLC that was teased when the game was announced for Nintendo Switch in 2022. "'Juliet' was the codename for a project where we were going to do a full remake of KOTOR II," Reilly said. [It would have featured] modern art, modern gameplay, you know, keep the story and the characters and the general--the general content of KOTOR II, but remake it for modern hardware and modern machines with updated graphics and all those kinds of things. It was something we were discussing with Aspyr. ... The plan was that we would remake the content that was in the RCM as it relates to Star Wars in that Juliet project." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Adventure Time: The Complete Collection On Sale For Best Price Ever
description: Adventure Time: The Complete Series (DVD) $41.49 (was $52.59) See at Amazon Adventure Time is widely considered to be one of Cartoon Network's best original animated projects, and if you haven't checked it out yet, you can grab a significant discount on the complete series. As part of a limited-time deal, the DVD box set for Adventure Time: The Complete Series has dropped to $41.49 (was $52.59). This collection includes all 10 seasons of the award-winning show, making it an excellent way to add the full series to your physical collection. Adventure Time: The Complete Series (DVD) $41.49 (was $52.59) Adventure Time: The Complete Series is a 22-disc box set containing all 279 episodes that aired from 2010 through 2018. The box set's packaging is based on the famed Enchiridion book from the show, and features an illustrated pop-up centerpiece of the series' characters. The collection also includes the Minecraft crossover bonus episode "Diamonds and Lemons," plus bonus materials like a selection of animatics that show how specific episodes were crafted, a deep-dive into the sound design of Adventure Time, music videos, and more. Adventure Time: The Complete Series bonus materials Sonic Sounds from Ooo Farewell Tour Animatics Music Videos Minecraft crossover episode, "Diamonds and Lemons" Special features from previous releases See at Amazon Adventure Time is one of Cartoon Network's breakout animated series. The show is set in the fantasy land of Ooo, and follow the adventures of Finn the Human and his adoptive brother, Jake the Dog. While the story starts as a fun fantasy adventure with equal parts homage and satire of the swords-and-sorcery genre, it slowly evolves into a sprawling epic with deep character development, and big narrative payoffs for longtime fans. The show is critically acclaimed for its strong storytelling and even stronger cast of characters, and its success has led to several spin-off projects, such as the Adventure Time: Distant Lands limited series, which is available on Blu-ray, and it's currently on sale for $12 (was $20) at Amazon. Adventure Time isn't the only beloved Cartoon Network series on DVD. All 245 episodes--and the movie--of Regular Show were collected into a home media release so that you can catch up on the absurd escapades of Mordecai and Rigby for just $44.49. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Tomb Raider News Confirmed For The Game Awards Following Remake Leak
description: There will be some kind of Tomb Raider announcement at The Game Awards on December 11. Host and organizer Geoff Keighley announced today, "Lara Croft returns at The Game Awards." "Tune in Thursday night for a look at the future of one of gaming's most iconic franchises, Tomb Raider," he said. "This is one you won't want to miss." Lara Croft returns at #TheGameAwards!As just revealed in our The Game Awards Vote in Fortnite map portal, tune in Thursday night for a look at the future of one of gaming's most iconic franchises @tombraider This is one you won't want to miss. pic.twitter.com/TSbWkyhAbI — Geoff Keighley (@geoffkeighley) December 8, 2025 The confirmation of a Tomb Raider announcement at The Game Awards comes not long after a new report emerged that said a remake of 1996's Tomb Raider was in the works and would be announced at the awards show. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Future Assassin's Creed Games Could Have Multiple Protagonists, Says AC Shadows Dev
description: Ubisoft has yet to share its plans for future Assassin's Creed games beyond Assassin's Creed Shadows, but that title's dual-protagonist setup with Yasuke and Naoe may not be the last time players get to have multiple characters to choose from. "I think the learning for us is that, yes, we could do more dual-protagonist games in the future--if we have a good reason to do it narratively and for the setting," said Assassin's Creed Shadows associate director Simon Lemay-Comtois while speaking with GamesRadar. Yasuke and Noae weren't the first dual protagonists in an Assassin's Creed game. Twins Jacob and Evie were featured in Assassin's Creed Syndicate. Shadows had more pronounced differences between its two heroes than Syndicate did. Yasuke was built for physical confrontations while Naoe was refined for stealth. Lemay-Comtois acknowledged those differences and some of the backlash the team faced because of Yasuke's inclusion. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: High On Life 2 Is Getting A Physical Edition Courtesy Of Limited Run Games
description: High on Life 2 $60 | Releases February 13, 2026 See at Amazon See at GameStop See at Best Buy High on Life 2 is launching on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, and Game Pass on February 13, 2026, which is right around the corner. Limited Run Games is publishing the physical console version of Sasquatch Games' colorful and irreverent sci-fi shooter. While the physical PS5 and Xbox Series X standard editions are currently sold out at Limited Run Games' online store, the PS5 version is still in stock at Amazon, Best Buy, and GameStop, and you can preorder it for $60. Preordering gets you a bonus weapon skin. High on Life 2 Preorder Bonuses High on Life 2 Preorder BonusesPreordering any version of High on Life 2 gets you an exclusive "I pre-ordered High on Life 2" Visor in-game weapon skin that can be worn by the game's roster of talking alien armaments. High on Life 2 $60 | Releases February 13, 2026 High on Life 2's standard edition include the base game, plus the bonus weapon skin if you preorder. Physical PS5 editions are available for $60 at Amazon, Best Buy, and GameStop. As mentioned above, the physical Xbox version is sold out. However, you can still preorder it digitally on both consoles and PC, and if you're an Xbox Game Pass subscriber, you'll be able to play on launch day. See at Amazon See at GameStop See at Best Buy Limited Run Games is also releasing a $180 High on Life 2 Collector's Edition that includes the game, an artbook, an 8-inch Bounty Hunter statue, a mini finger-sized skateboard, and a soundtrack. Unfortunately, preorders for this LRG-exclusive version ended on October 5. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Microsoft Initially Rejected Idea To Bring Flight Simulator To PS5, Dev Says
description: Microsoft originally rejected a pitch to bring Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 to PlayStation consoles, but the company eventually agreed, and this led to a "whole avalanche" of Xbox games on PlayStation. That's according to Head of Microsoft Flight Simulator Jorg Neumann. He told XDA-Developers that it was his own idea to bring Flight Simulator to PlayStation consoles, culminating with the launch of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 today, December 8, on PS4 and PS5. The 2020 Flight Simulator game eventually grew to become 300 GB in size, and there was so much content planned that Neumann said the game could grow to become 1 TB. So instead of doing that, the team made a new game, Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, and the game now only has 8 GB of space for a requirement, with everything else sent to the cloud. This way of packaging the game allowed the game to come to other platforms, Neumann said. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: PS5 Was The No. 1 Best-Selling Console This Black Friday In The US
description: The PlayStation 5 dominated Black Friday sales in the US, according to new data shared by Circana, which tracks gaming sales in the US. Circana's Mat Piscatella said Sony's console made up 47% of total Black Friday week hardware unit sales, outpacing the Switch 2 (24%) and Nex Playground (14%). He didn't share any data about how Xbox performed. "So, yeah, Black Friday week is extremely promotional for video games. Stuff that does not price promote (generally speaking, here) does not see much of a seasonal lift at all from the prior week (usually none). BF Week performance can correlate closely to what's being promoted and by how much," Piscatella said. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Guides Hub
description: Are you eager to set foot on the planet of Viewros in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond? This world is filled with both opportunities and dangers. As Samus Aran, you'll seek out the secrets of the Lamorn, an ancient race with psychic powers and highly coveted technologies. Our Metroid Prime 4: Beyond guides hub has everything you need to know to help you throughout your journey. Abilities and upgrades - It wouldn't be a Metroid game without acquiring power-ups that allow you to explore new areas. From different weapon types and boosts for your Morph Ball to psychic-based actions, these abilities become integral not just for campaign progression, but also for general exploration and discovering all sorts of secrets. Bosses - As Samus, you'll face a plethora of enemies. A select few of these opponents are strange amalgamations of beasts and constructs, all eager to finish you off if you're not careful. Continue Reading at GameSpot
